<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Policy for the pruneCache() function. A default constructed</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">/// CachePruningPolicy provides a reasonable default policy.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy">CachePruningPolicy</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The pruning interval. This is intended to be used to avoid scanning the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// directory too often. It does not impact the decision of which file to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// prune. A value of 0 forces the scan to occur. A value of std::nullopt</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// disables pruning.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a26f65d4efd088dd6f035a970ef350628"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::optional&lt;std::chrono::seconds&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a26f65d4efd088dd6f035a970ef350628">Interval</a> = std::chrono::seconds(1200);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The expiration for a file. When a file hasn&#39;t been accessed for Expiration</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// seconds, it is removed from the cache. A value of 0 disables the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// expiration-based pruning.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a4e4e128e83c615ca4ed425980b41e64f"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::chrono::seconds <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a4e4e128e83c615ca4ed425980b41e64f">Expiration</a> = std::chrono::hours(7 &#42; 24); </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1w</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The maximum size for the cache directory, in terms of percentage of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// available space on the disk. Set to 100 to indicate no limit, 50 to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// indicate that the cache size will not be left over half the available disk</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// space. A value over 100 will be reduced to 100 A value of 0 disables the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// percentage size-based pruning.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#ac13a6c169c6b44529d9f6bae76c8b4ed"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#ac13a6c169c6b44529d9f6bae76c8b4ed">MaxSizePercentageOfAvailableSpace</a> = 75;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The maximum size for the cache directory in bytes. A value over the amount</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of available space on the disk will be reduced to the amount of available</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// space. A value of 0 disables the absolute size-based pruning.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a8c514fa2ef23ee2f092cedf2691886dd"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a8c514fa2ef23ee2f092cedf2691886dd">MaxSizeBytes</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The maximum number of files in the cache directory. A value of 0 disables</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the number of files based pruning.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This defaults to 1000000 because with that many files there are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// diminishing returns on the effectiveness of the cache. Some systems have a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// limit on total number of files, and some also limit the number of files</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// per directory, such as Linux ext4, with the default setting (block size is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 4096 and large&#95;dir disabled), there is a per-directory entry limit of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 508&#42;510&#42;floor(4096/(40+8))~=20M for average filename length of 40</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a0b73cd4206ae3e5edc07c24afb2057ac"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy/#a0b73cd4206ae3e5edc07c24afb2057ac">MaxSizeFiles</a> = 1000000;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Parse the given string as a cache pruning policy. Defaults are taken from a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">/// default constructed CachePruningPolicy object.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For example: &quot;prune&#95;interval=30s:prune&#95;after=24h:cache&#95;size=50%&quot;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which means a pruning interval of 30 seconds, expiration time of 24 hours</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and maximum cache size of 50% of available disk space.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected&lt;CachePruningPolicy&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a4accb2c6a0d7504200a547f2284ff106">parseCachePruningPolicy</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> PolicyStr);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Peform pruning using the supplied policy, returns true if pruning</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">/// occurred, i.e. if Policy.Interval was expired.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Check whether cache pruning happens using the supplied policy, adds a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ThinLTO warning if cache&#95;size&#95;bytes or cache&#95;size&#95;files is too small for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">/// current link job. The warning recommends the user to consider adjusting</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">/// --thinlto-cache-policy.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">/// As a safeguard against data loss if the user specifies the wrong directory</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">/// as their cache directory, this function will ignore files not matching the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">/// pattern &quot;llvmcache-&#42;&quot;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aabba6d27907082520ad2eb977c8e406b">pruneCache</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Path, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cachepruningpolicy">CachePruningPolicy</a> Policy,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="normal">                </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::vector&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;MemoryBuffer&gt;&gt; &amp;Files = &#123;&#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
